Learn to SUP-Foil Downwind on one of the best spots in Europe.
https://supfoil.ch/
This is a great Downwind beginner run or to test new gear. Once over 17kn of wind, it starts to get tricky with backwash

Train: Get on the tain at St Blaise Lac (has to be spelled like this to be found on the SBB app) to Neuchatel. 
Departures are normally at 
xx:36
xx:49
(as of April 2025) verify yourself!
https://www.sbb.ch/
South-West

Webcam gives you a good impression about the current conditions:
https://lacdeneuchatel.roundshot.co/#/

For wind check: https://letskite.ch/en
For waves in Neuch√¢tel check this webcam link: https://jeunesrives.roundshot.com/#/

Longest possible Bise run.
Check wind: https://letskite.ch/en
Check waves in Neuch√¢tel: https://jeunesrives.roundshot.com/

We have a group chat for this run: https://chat.whatsapp.com/DPFmgw7m15T0iZ0P1pbe53
Local people:
https://instagram.com/nilsmango
https://www.instagram.com/supfoil.ch

Great run with south-west wind. Train directly to the start.
Best waves are on the inside in my opinion.
Group chat for this run: https://chat.whatsapp.com/DPFmgw7m15T0iZ0P1pbe53
http://lacdeneuchatel.roundshot.com/#/

It's a wooden dock by the way, pretty low. There is a higher plastic dock across the river too!
Most of the time there are also some free (and higher) boat docks nearby.
Super easy concrete dock near the trainsation!

Public Pumpfoildock.
Perfect for waketiefing the wave of the Kursschiff.
Easyer for goofy pumpers to start.

Book Pumpfoil-lessons with Ken Ruis!
https://www.foilsolothurn.ch/
Fun Run :D

Parawing downwind run. Only works when there is a lot of S√ºdf√∂n pressure (I think it needs at least 12 hPa).
Check pressure here: https://www.srf.ch/meteo/surf-und-segelwetter/diagramme-foehn-und-bise
Even if the whole lake is full with white caps I never take a smaller foil than 980 sq cm. The waves never get very big.

Very bad in the beginning, you really have to paddle out first. But nice train schedule.
Might be good with a parawing as you could simply ride out to the center of the lake for better bumps.

Great Bise run when there is not enough wind in Neuch√¢tel.
For wind measurements check: https://letskite.ch/en
Nice train connections, also good parking at start or at end.
I like to stay at the shore as I find the waves there the cleanest.
You can also go out at Concise or Grandson.

Top train connections, good with strong Bise.
Be careful to fly well around Pointe de Promenthoux due to backwash.
Otherwise, stay more in the middle towards the end.

Y Plage 
School / Renting 
Sup / Wing / Foil

Easy small downwind  run by bise 
To learn Foil 
Or sup race
Website: https://y-plage.ch/en/

When there is F√∂hn above 40 knots the f√∂hn will blow through sisikon and you can ride till brunnen. Bumps are from isleten super clean, gets messy before sisikon and are getting better from sisikon till Brunnen. Check the Webcam in Sisikon or/and in Brunnen if the Wind blows through
Bise very cool and easy run to learn dockstart downwind. Lot of docks to restart in case of falling on the way.
South west wind or Bise, both direction works to downwind, around 1h run if you don't fall.
Very gusty and small. Be careful to not let yourself get down into the forbidden zone behind the fireboat!

Webcams:
Basel
https://webtv.feratel.com/webtv/?cam=4175&design=v3&c0=0&c2=1&lg=de&s=0

Meine Notizen von fr√ºher:
Ostwind
Jeden morgen im Sommer (wahrscheinlich nicht genug)
Muss mind. 10 km/h Wetterstation, damit es funktioniert - aber schwierig zu sagen, muss man schauen gehen - nur bei richtig viel wind!! 20 kn vorhersage, 20 km/h durchschnitt fast schon.

Westwind
Wenn in Binningen so 10 kn: ab 16-17 Uhr
Muss mind 8-10 kn und dann noch Thermik!

Wetterstation Binningen ab 8 km/h und Spitzen ab ca. 20 km/h - dann ist der Wind wahrscheinlich Spitzen etwa 10 Knoten, Durchschnitt 6 Knoten. Das ist was ich brauche mit 210er und 4.5.

Wetterstation Binningen:
https://www.meteoschweiz.admin.ch/service-und-publikationen/applikationen/messwerte-und-messnetze.html#param=messwerte-windgeschwindigkeit-kmh-10min&table=false&station=BAS
Nice little pump foil dock in Basel.
Nice webcam to see the wind in Brienz: https://axis.webcam-brienz.ch/axis-cgi/mjpg/video.cgi

Webcams: https://bielersee.live
Wind Measurements: https://wsa-ipsach.meteobase.ch/index.php
More Wind: https://biel-hafen.meteobase.ch/index.php

Local club: https://wsci.ch
Local legend: https://www.instagram.com/radiculo/

Virgina Key is an amazing wing foil wave spot. Best on NNW, N, E, SE, and S winds. Tide can be factor as the seagrass flats are shallow near low tide, consider bringing a 75cm mast or avoiding the 1hr on either side of low tides. In an E wind VK offers flat water upwind of the launch with progressively growing waves as you head further upwind. Be mindful of the shallow sandbar upwind where waves will be breaking.
Dedicated area to launch kites and wings on south beach. Best in any wind with some east. Can have a large shore-break in strong east winds.

In northeast winds the port everglades jetty cleans up the wind chops, combined with some outgoing current hood river style bumps form. This is an advanced spot with ship traffic and a challenging chip in prone.
Fun wing spot, nice grass set up area. Works in any east wind, shore-break can be an issue.
Great pump foil dock. Floating with a long run up.
Great wingfoil and kite spot. The reef near Hillsboro inlet lessens the shorebreak. Works on any wind with east.
Great sandbar for prone, also good area to launch kites and wing from. Works in all east wind directions shore-break is factor in strong east winds.
Really nice place and very nice people! Beware of the trash pandas!
Miami Winger WA Group: https://chat.whatsapp.com/Bp9snrbKNAVKB3VFNhM311

Local website by Mickey with infos etc: 
https://mickeyk6000.wixsite.com/foilers

On its day one of the best wing spots on the east coast. Best set up in strong north wind. Launch under the protected jetty, get access to some well overhead north swell. If you cannot stay upwind be careful as the shore-break is very large only 1/2 mile south of the jetty.
Prone/Sup spot on east wind. Very strong outgoing tide creates standing waves. Can also be a fun wing spot but wind is often fickle. Advanced spot as you can be swept out into 2x overhead waves.

Nice little bay wing spot if you stay at any of the motels on this side.
Great if you want to see Manatees.

Please make sure to always take care with swimmers and rowers. 

The rowing club is the placeholder of the area - so always remember we‚Äòre just acting as guests at the spot.
Amazing concise webcam: http://46.14.58.189/mjpg/video.mjpg
Great webcam in Concise: http://46.14.58.189/mjpg/video.mjpg
Great spot when there is wind if you are a mountain dwelling wingfoiler
Another beautiful high mountain reservoir with great wind sometimes.
Great spot when wind from due west, it‚Äôs possible to shuttle a DWer from west to east.
Downwind from here to Malcesine (bus parking) then walk back upwind. Ideal for beginners. Good steep bumps in morning Pel√®r winds. Get up EARLY! ü§ô
DW Bregancon-Hy√®res
East Wind
There are a couple of local WhatsApp groups. Simply ask around. This is the community Instagram account: https://www.instagram.com/med_gliders/

Best east wind run in Hy√®res. Pretty long paddle out in the beginning. 
Stay outside of the buoy.
Parking at the start ca. 10 EUR, free in winter.

Great run if you‚Äôre comfortable with 20km+ runs.

Easy entry thanks to sandy beach close to Puzziteddu Surf Center
San Marco Beach is nice and sandy to exit and thanks to some outer banks the shore brake isn‚Äôt to (at lest with the 20kn of wind I had there)
According to google maps it looks like most of the coast you‚Äôre passing along is sandy so shorter runs and/or emergency exits shouldn‚Äôt be that difficult
West
You‚Äôll need to car shuttle‚Ä¶ drive is almost 1h one way‚Ä¶
SW, W, NW

Car Shuttle only
Start: Park at Ahoi Camping and walk to the peak (past the Aussichtsplattform Westermarkelsdorfer Huk)
End: Come in, at the corner of the harbor, sea wall, and shore. Sand bank to land on(one big stone you don't want to hit. You'll see it if you zoom in on Google Maps) 
Big parking lot right at the end of the run
Malte & Basti from wingfoil-fehmarn.de

Nice, steep and surfy bumps for the first half of the run (also worth doing up and DW runs with a parawing).
The second part gets technical. 
Make sure you stay far enough out at Gr√ºner Brink, as the sandbank ‚Äúkills‚Äù all the bumps
Longest possible single downwind run in Switzerland. Be careful with possible thunderstorms.
Great dw run on North-east wind and small to no ground swell
The bay offers great prone and tow-in conditions according to the tides and winds.
Foilsurfing.club offers coaching and teaching for all kind of riders. From beginner to advanced: wingfoil, downwind sup foil, parawing and tow-in in waves
test

Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: About 50 cm depending on status of the lake.. no ladder to climb out. Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/p/C8r9yXPqZGv/, https://www.instagram.com/p/C8sH-n2q6Hw/

Spotfinder: zooosky. Height to water: Pumpfoil ramp 50 cm over water mounted to the dock. The spot is near the restaurant Le Peniche in Biel. Images of spot: https://images2.imgbox.com/20/ab/ut4CFllz_o.jpg
Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: About 50 cm over the water.  Easy to climb out. Good for Goofy and Regular Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/reel/CPIpCFojcuz/
Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: About 40cm over the water. Good for Goofy and Regular, very popular Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/p/CxBkhkDq1QT/
Spotfinder: zdavatz. Good for SUPfoil and Wingfoil practice. Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/p/CysgnsoKXs1/

Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: Max 20cm √ºber dem Wasser. Drop von der Hafenmauer ist cool. Gut f√ºr Goofy und Regular. Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/reel/Cz-r559qdVT/, https://www.instagram.com/p/Cz8_3GwKdOH/

Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: 40cm √ºber dem Wasser. Nur f√ºr Hauptsaison (Winter) offen f√ºr die √ñffentlichkeit. W√§hrend dem Badibetrieb ist ASVZ Schulung morgens von 7-9 Uhr Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/p/Cy-yeAZtlrp/

Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: 50cm √ºber dem Wasser. Hier gibt es Fischer. Gute Welle von den Kursschiffen, guter Hafen zum Tricks √ºben. Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/p/C0WtaAnK6Om/
Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: 60cm √ºber dem Wasser. Achtung Kursschiffe. Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/reel/C4vWxdJqFhO/

Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: 20 cm √ºber Wasser. Der Ursprung von Pump Ts√ºri. Nur in der Hauptsaison (Winter), nach dem offiziellen Badebetrieb. Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/p/C5dTeoPKrrG/
Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: 30 cm √ºber Wasser. Am Donnerstag Nachmittag kann man Material mieten. Goofy und Regular. Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/reel/C5puupIKwJ1/
Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: 15 cm √ºber Wasser. Gerry Gearloose hat seinen Shop hier. Gut zum Material testen. Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/p/C7a26EXKT5v/
Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: 20-40cm √ºber Wasser. Hier kann man Mitglied werden. Gut zum t√§glich √ºben. Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/p/C79YoCzK0iv/
Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: 50cm √ºber Wasser. Immer sehr viele Leute (Taucher, Schwimmer, Pumper). Dock hat zwei Leitern. Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/p/C_IvVANKor_/

Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: 60cm √ºber Wasser. Der Dock ist eher hoch. Gut zum Dropstarten. Es gibt eine Leiter und eine Dusche und ein WC. Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/reel/CtopO-TqYuJ/
Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: 15-20cm √ºber Wasser. Gut f√ºr Beachstart, Sidestart und Frogstart. Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/p/Cl8W6Jbqdwp/
Spotfinder: zdavatz. Height to water: 25-35cm √ºber Wasser - je nach Flussh√∂he. Gut f√ºr regular Sidestart. Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/p/COhzth3jq6O/
Spotfinder: lkoeppel. Height to water: 20-30cm √ºber dem Wasser. Alle Starts m√∂glich Images of spot: https://pump.zuerich/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/kos_dockstart.jpeg
Spotfinder: k√ºs√∂ggeler. Height to water: Steg wird von Santosh mitgebracht. Alle Starts m√∂glich, viele Wellen von den Schiffen Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/reel/DBx_jOzP2u4/
Spotfinder: dlieber. Height to water: Neben der Badi. ca. 40 cm √ºber dem Wasser Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/p/C79YoCzK0iv/
Spotfinder: Santosh. Height to water: Steg wird von Santosh mitgebracht. Alle Starts m√∂glich, viele Wellen von den Schiffen Images of spot: https://www.instagram.com/reel/DBx_jOzP2u4/
Spotfinder: aloulier. Height to water: Steg sieht gut aus. Alle Starts m√∂glich, einige Wellen von den Schiffen Images of spot: https://maps.app.goo.gl/RWbpJ8o3opRZx7xK7?g_st=aw
World in ENE, NE, SSW and SW

This is maybe the best spot for downwinding in the Arendal region in both NE and SW wind directions because it is exposed and there are no islands blocking the swell here. A shallow reef maybe 500m offshore provides great bumps. Not yet tested on foil but can confirm from windsurfing here many times .

Nice run on Lake Bodensee. Train available!
You can also get out at Lindau for a shorter run.
The very best west wind run on lake Neuch√¢tel.

Forecasts: https://project7iii.com/foildata/lac-de-neuchatel-forecasts.html

Webcams: https://project7iii.com/foildata/lac-de-neuchatel-webcams.html
Great beginner run in NE (Bise) conditions

chasse sur rhones has been called hawaii sur rhones by windsurfers 30 years ago. it work only with very strong south wind (30knots minimum)
magic spot between factory, hight way, the train...etc
Make sure you check the level of the river. flood condtion is a bit more messy but lot of debris, big waves, high speed, but tricky.

-video 1 in summer condition, not so much current, but still enough to go upwind by sitting on the board.
-video 2 in november , 40N, 2.50meters flood, strong current, very very fast to go upwind, big waves (2meters)
-video 3, be carefull with flood, lot of debris and gifts under the water
Forecast for the region: https://www.windguru.cz/193

Lac de Joux is something else. Ireland on one side, Canada or Sweden on the other.
With strong wind possible to downwind with a big foil.
Perfect for up-down winder from L'Abbaye. Nice parking behind the hotel, great place to get out.

Awesome bay run! Parking at the parking, then walk down (sketchy), jump in (also sketchy).
When getting out in Almanarre, be carful, there are rocks on the left (marked by yellow buoys).
https://www.instagram.com/med_gliders/
https://www.windguru.cz/501012

Big Hy√®res run. Get in at the beach, then paddle out to the wind line.
Huge rollers.
Be carful with the police, I heard you are not really allowed to paddle on the open ocean in France.

Normal El M√©dano Run
You are not allowed inside the red buoy - be careful.

Bigger El M√©dano run.
You have to really be far out when coming to the harbour wall, otherwise you are in the backwash, and it's brutal.

Longer Harbour Run
I don't know where to get out really. Sketchy as if you overshoot and you most likely die ;)
Cool wave spot. Don't go too far to the windsurfers.
Cool wave spot. Lots of kiters, but also lots of waves.
